findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: The owner of the GeneralYieldSourceAdapter can update the address of the yield source vault, allowing them to control revenue share distribution and enable deposits and withdrawals for the revenue shares.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Transaction execution costs should not depend dramatically on the amount of data stored on the contract. There should not be any cases when execution fails due to the block Gas limit.

findings.title: Style Guide Violation - Order of Functions
Requirements Compliance
findings.description: The contracts do not fully comply with the functional and technical requirements.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: Code coverage of the project is 100% (branch coverage). Deployment and basic user interactions are covered with tests. Negative cases coverage is present. Interactions by several users are tested.

findings.title: H01. Invalid Calculations
findings.description: In the _convertAssetsToYieldSourceShares() and _convertYieldSourceSharesToAssets() functions, calculations are done incorrectly.
